review_title: Maybe a little too laid back
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Durango, CO
pros: I was able to get homework done during my shift and my supervisors were really nice. It was also nice to be around other Native Americans and the conversations I would overhear were pretty funny. They also had food Thursdays where they would sell traditional Native dishes.
cons: The pay wasn't able to cover all my expenses so I was living paycheck to paycheck. I didn't get enough hours and there wasn't enough to do around the office. I would go in and clean and answer phones sometimes but like I said above, I had a lot of time to get my homework done.

review_title: MOST TOXIC WORKPLACE I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY LIFE
pros: they don’t verify training or experience
cons: toxic environment on every single level, rampant nepotism, don’t waste your time

review_title: NAHC
job_title: Program Manager II in Oakland, CA
pros:
Strong work ethic
Respectful colleagues
Social dynamics
cons: Pay is on the lower end for the Bay Area.

review_title: Ma
pros: It’s a union company so it helps a bit
cons: Lack of support for the ma

review_title: Great team, meaningful work, supportive environment
job_title: Licensed Behavioral Health Clinician in Oakland, CA
pros: My favorite employer so far
cons: Management experts a lot but is available, flexibile, and supportive.

review_title: hopeful but disappointed
pros: Great mission for the native population
cons: Poor leadership, grants mismanaged, demeaning atmosphere

review_title: Horrible senior management with no clinical experience micromanaging the company
pros: A handful of staff members who are caring and hardworking.  Fairly good benefits.
cons:
Dental -- horrible and numerous patient complaints of poorly done dental work
Medical -- patient problems not addressed in a timely and professional manner, poor follow up of patients, not enough time allotted for each patient to be seen properly and their problems addressed
Overall -- poor telephonic system, no one can get through, numerous complaints.  Favoritism and racism evident especially in Senior management.  Nepotism evident.  No room for advancement unless you're Native.  Lack of follow through.  Some great ideas but mostly all talk and no action.  Indecisiveness and clinical suggestions denied by non-clinical upper management.  Ineffective managers with no clinical skills -- evaluations not done in a timely manner, bad employees retained because of fear of confrontation.  HR unresponsive and payroll unresponsive.  Horrible on-boarding process.  Lack of communication throughout the agency.  No benefits for advancement of education.  Unsafe environment with no parking spaces available.  Offers help but do not actually mean it -- refusing to help when staff reaches out.  No compensation for cost of living change.  Ineffective union representatives.

review_title: Awful management that does not appreciate you, stressful and poor daily flow, good benefits and fellow employess
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: The 2 stars are for the benefits and my fellow employees.  My fellow employees work really hard and kept me sane.
cons: Management is horrible.  They only care that you produce as much as you can for them. They work you into the ground and make sure that you feel as unappreciated as possible.  They are extremely defensive, unprofessional and juvenile, no matter how big or small of an issue.  They penny pinch every situation as well.  On top of that, they are incredibly two faced and retaliatory, and only nice to people that they can get something out of.  The ergonomics are really bad and have caused several employees injuries in which they cannot work to their full capacity anymore.  The management is aware of this, but nothing has changed. The pay here sucks compared to every other comparable organization.  They try to make up for it with good benefits. The overall morale is very low.  There is therefore a very high turnover rate of employees, which adds to the daily stress and mess.

review_title: PIMC
pros: Training paid. Volenteer hours. Food. Holiday banquet.
cons: Work burn out. System slow. No IT. No real management

review_title: Extremely sickening dysfunctional environment, horrific experience. Employees are made to feel worthless & of no value.
pros: They're union. You may find a good person or two who actually care for the community and the true mission of the clinic.
cons: Non-competitive salary, absolute minimum pay in the industry. Clinic is in a high crime rate area, no staff parking, very little public parking, mostly metered, no security. Nepotism is rampant. Micro-management. Favoritism is obvious, seniority is useless. Policies not applied fairly. Policy is unclear and they make access to the policies and procedures manual difficult. Information not shared across departments. Extremely high staff turnover. Constant payroll issues and errors, not being paid properly or on time is common. Poor staff training. No regard for seniority. Employees are given no respect as a human being. A lot of company and community politics, inside turmoil, problems amongst staff, total toxic environment. Entire staff is voiceless.

review_title: Great place to work! Really can see how working here betters the community.
job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Oakland, CA
pros:
I work with a great team at NAHC! Everyone is cross-trained so it never feels like the job is all out on one person, and it also makes for a great resume builder. 

NAHC often has fun and free fitness classes for staff members. Every year they have a staff appreciation "spirit week". Internal trainings offered to supervisors frequently. Great benefits! 

I feel great working here, because I also know that the work I do and that this organization does is helping the community, both the Native American community and the Bay Area community.
cons: No staff parking, which would be great add because all NAHC sites are in busy areas with tough to find street parking.

review_title: Toxic environment
pros: A few caring co-workers who are supportive and hardworking.  A few helpful employees who want to make a difference.  Caters to the poor community.
cons: Contradictory messages to staff. Doesn't value employee opinions and input. Lacks support from management.  Favoritism apparent throughout organization.  Unsafe practices throughout organization and swept under the rug.  Lack of leadership skills and untrained staff.  Lack of accountability for decisions made by upper management.  Disorganized, chaotic and hostile environment.  Workers stealing from the company and taking advantage of the system.  Payroll issues -- employees not getting paid on time and accurately.  Lack of access to patients -- hard for patients to get through phones, get referrals or medications or appointments.

review_title: Disorganized internal conflicts
job_title: Health Care Provider in Oakland, CA
pros: Genuine and caring coworkers.  We have a strong sense of purpose and community.  Fun community events all year.
cons:
Rampant nepotism.  Destructive gossip presides over policy and procedure.   Promotions not based on skill, seniority or merit.  Health related business and professional codes are flouted.
Internal organization and task flow is redundant and cumbersome.  Constant internal fighting and conflict.  Revolving door for employees.

review_title: Great Organization that met the needs of the San Francisco Bay Area Native American Community
job_title: Director of HIV Services in San Francisco, CA
pros: The clientele and patients reflected a diverse population and culture in a rich and heavily populated urban metropolitian area with unique needs that the organization strived to meet directly or collaboratively.
cons: Local was sometimes cumbersome to get to.

review_title: Opportunities to Learn and Grow!
pros: There are lots of opportunities to grow and learn new skills. Colleagues are ambitious and care for the patients and for each other. Excellent benefit package!
cons: some employees are slackers which affects the hard working ones.

review_title: Fullfilling and stressful
pros: Great cultural focus, great patient centered care and holistic approach to health.
cons: Difficult infrastructure/tech systems, mid to lower management is average or below, and there are lots of stagnant/malignant workers.

review_title: Doing Good Work for Native Americans and their Culture
job_title: Psychology Practicum Student in Oakland, CA
pros: Positive environment that fosters care and compassion.
cons: Under funded, as are most organizations that do this work.

review_title: They have great benefits and its union
pros: I loved my patients and supervisor Karen Harrison
cons: The pay wasn't good at all but the benefits made up for it.

review_title: Community mental health cares
pros: Positive work environment, caring & supportive coworkers, family atmosphere, focused on community awareness & advocacy
cons: Few opportunities for growth, nonprofit salary

review_title: LVN
pros: love it there, great customer service
cons: no cons, I really loved it there
